name: Best Oyster Chowder Ever
author: Deborah Norris
summary: You can make an oyster chowder in the middle of the desert with this recipe and you will be in the middle of the ocean with delight.
ingredients: 1 (12 ounce) container shucked oysters, drained with liquid reserved
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Cook oysters and reserved liquid in a skillet over medium heat until edges curl, 5 to 10 minutes
Combine onion, potato, broccoli, water, and corn in a saucepan; bring to a boil
Reduce heat and simmer until vegetables are tender, 10 to 15 minutes
Melt butter in a large pan over medium heat
Stir flour into melted butter until smooth, about 1 minute
Slowly pour reserved vegetable water and milk into butter-flour mixture; cook until thickened, about 5 minutes
Add oysters and vegetables to milk mixture and cook over medium-low heat until heated through, about 5 minutes
